meanings.definition: A painful inflammation of the skin caused by prolonged exposure to cold temperatures.
meanings.sent1: After playing in the snow for hours, Sarah developed a chilblain on her toe.
meanings.sent2: The doctor diagnosed the red, swollen area on his foot as a chilblain.
meanings.sent3: The chilblain on his finger made it hard for him to hold the icy popsicle.
meanings.sent4: Her chilblain felt like a burning coal under her skin.
meanings.sent5: The chilblain throbbed with each beat of her heart, a constant reminder of the cold.

meanings.definition: To develop chilblains on the skin due to cold weather.
meanings.sent1: If you don't wear gloves, you might chilblain your fingers in this freezing weather.
meanings.sent2: She always chilblains easily when exposed to chilly winds.
meanings.sent3: Trying to warm up by the fire, he joked that he was chilblaining himself on purpose.
meanings.sent4: The frost seemed to chilblain the landscape, turning it into a frozen wonderland.
meanings.sent5: The cold air seemed to chilblain her skin instantly, leaving a tingling sensation.
